channel.title: Hacker News - English
channel.description: Hacker News articles summarized and translated to English

item.title: You can't cURL a Border
item.description:
Any government form that asked "where have you been. ¶ That twenty-minute panic before buying a flight comes from one basic problem: none of the systems that judge you will tell you your state. None of that is easily exposed.

Read more

item.title: Lessons from 70 interviews on deploying AI Agents in production
item.description:
As the ecosystem is in such nascent stages, most (52%) startups are building their agentic infrastructure fully or predominantly in-house. Autonomy: AI agents act independently without needing constant inputs/instructions from humans; they make decisions and take actions (via tool calling) based on the changing world around them. Given the nascence of GenAI-powered agents and assorted reliability issues around them (and enterprise practitioners’ caution around deploying fully autonomous systems), our definition of agents does not require full autonomy.

Read more

item.title: Some software bloat is OK
item.description:
Windows 11 Calculator alone consumes more than 30MiB of RAM. Modern software tends to be more complicated. This didn't exist much in older era software.

Read more

item.title: Pain Points of OCaml
item.description:
I think that Rust was definitely correct for making type annotations for function parameters and return values explicit despite also being based on Hindley-Milner type inference. My gripe with these is that they are two DSLs that opaquely compile to OCaml source files and have their own (separate) semantics and grammar. They also emit errors where the entire diagnostic is just "Syntax Error", which is difficult to debug considering that these are DSLs with OCaml embedded within them.

Read more

item.title: Show HN: MyTimers.app offline-first PWA with no build step and zero dependencies
